column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DMV TEST
column4: New Hampshire

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turns
column8: Keep right

column2: 3. Drowsy drivers:
column4: can stay awake by opening a window.
column6: are at risk of being involved in a crash.
column8: should drink coffee to stay awake.

column2: 4. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column8: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Yield
column8: No left turn

column2: 6. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column6: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column8: Drivers are not required to stop.
column10: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks have the right of way
column8: Left lane must turn left

column2: 8. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column6: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column8: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column10: reduce speed and increase following distance.

column2: 9. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: Get enough sleep.

column2: 10. A red traffic signal light means that you must:
column4: stop at the stop line.
column6: where there is no stop line or crosswalk, stop before entering the intersection.
column8: when there is no stop line, stop before entering any crosswalk.

column2: 11. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
column6: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.
column8: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 13. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Do not panic.
column8: Call the police.

column2: 14. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: try to pass close behind.
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 15. When driving through a curve, you should:
column4: speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.
column6: stay near the right of your lane.
column8: maintain constant speed.
column10: slow as you enter, speed up as you exit.

column2: 16. This signal means:
column4: Stop
column8: Move to the left

column2: 17. The sign in the picture:
column4: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: means that you need to stop.
column10: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: road construction.
column8: narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 19. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 20. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column8: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column10: always sound their horn and stay alert.

column2: 21. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: blue; white
column8: green; white

column2: 22. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column8: look well down the road and far off to each side.

column2: 23. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: has no effect, they are different substances.
column6: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.
column8: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column10: reduces the effects of the alcohol.

column2: 24. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: use alternate routes.
column8: take turns more slowly.
column10: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 25. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
26. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 27. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column8: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 28. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column4: red, green and yellow.
column8: red, yellow and green.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right
column8: A side road enters ahead

column2: 30. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column4: black; white
column8: yellow; black

column2: 31. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: towards the left side of the road.
column8: straight down the middle of the road.
column10: towards the right side of the road.

column2: 32. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: has the right-of-way.
column10: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 33. Drivers can proceed through an intersection with a stop sign, but no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: after coming to a complete stop, when it is safe to proceed.
column6: after stopping at least 50 feet prior to the intersection.
column8: after slowing down to ensure there is no cross-traffic.
column10: after slowing down to at least 15 MPH before proceeding.

column2: 34. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column4: blue; white
column8: red; red

column2: 35. On a road with two or more lanes in the same direction, you approach an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its warning lights on. You must:
column4: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column6: slow down. If possible, change lanes.
column8: pass the emergency vehicle as quickly as possible.
column10: maintain your current speed and stay in your lane.

column2: 36. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Listen to heavy metal music.
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 37. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: yield to other pedestrians.
column8: stop immediately.
column10: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 38. When driving on a wet road:
column4: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column6: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column8: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column10: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.

column2: 39. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column6: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column8: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: Lane change
column8: Hospital parking ahead
